cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with handwritten text line segmentation, which is a common task in computer vision. It also uses Expectation-Maximization algorithm and variational approaches, which are commonly used in computer vision. 

It could also belong to the natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-category as it deals with text segmentation. 

The paper also involves probabilistic modeling, which is a common topic in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. 

Finally, the paper involves inference on Markov random fields, which is a common topic in information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
